summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from September 21, 2021, discussing coordination regarding a discovery request related to the Epstein case. The emails are between an FBI Special Agent in New York and a Program Manager in the Victim Services Division, referencing a need to connect with an OGC attorney named Maggie about a spreadsheet submitted with an Epstein discovery request form.

persons.name: Maggie
persons.context: Attorney in the FBI's Office of General Counsel who wants to schedule a call regarding a spreadsheet attachment submitted with an Epstein discovery request form.

persons.name: Angela
persons.context: Mentioned as being involved in the Gabby Petito case and thus potentially unavailable.

connections.description: L. is following up on an email from Maggie regarding an Epstein discovery request, indicating a working relationship on legal matters.
L. mentions Angela is working on the Gabby Petito case, suggesting they are colleagues within the FBI.

events.title: OGC inquiry regarding Epstein discovery
events.description: Internal FBI email discussion about coordinating a call with OGC attorney Maggie regarding a spreadsheet submitted with an Epstein discovery request form.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively processing discovery requests related to the Epstein case as of September 2021.
A specific spreadsheet attachment was submitted with an Epstein discovery request form, requiring legal review by the Office of General Counsel.
The email indicates internal FBI coordination between the New York Field Office, the Victim Services Division, and the Office of General Counsel on Epstein-related matters.
The mention of the Gabby Petito case provides temporal context, situating this Epstein work amidst other high-profile investigations.
